    How to use the SupplyChain365 Portal (overview)

    The SupplyChain365 portal is a gateway between users, components and the logistics system.

    This is how to log in to the SupplyChain365 Portal. First go to https://portal.supplychain365.net.

    Then click log in to enter the main page of the SupplyChain365 Portal.

    Note: the SupplyChain365 Portal works with your company’s registered email address.

    Here we see a number of different menus. Let’s look at them one by one. On the right side, there is the SupplyChain365 logo. By clicking it you see the current user and the sign out button. Next to the SupplyChain365 logo, you see the language menu where you can choose between different languages.

    With the buttons on the left side, you can navigate to all the important pages, such as the home page that displays which organization is currently using the SupplyChain365 Portal.

    The components menu consists of different options like labels, printers, devices and more. The admin menu consists of administration and management options regarding different aspects of the SupplyChain365 Portal. The last one is the help button, with which you can navigate to the support portal, where you will find information about the Supplychain365 Portal. In upcoming videos we will jump deeper into each of these menus.

    Below a video to understand the steps in an overview:

    Why we love Cookies

    We use cookies to try and give you a better experience in Supplychain365.

    You can learn more about what kind of cookies we use, why, and how from our Privacy policy. If you hate cookies, or are just on a diet, you can disable them altogether too. Just note that the Freshdesk service is pretty big on some cookies (we love the choco-chip ones), and some portions of Freshdesk may not work properly if you disable cookies.

    We’ll also assume you agree to the way we use cookies and are ok with it as described in our Privacy policy, unless you choose to disable them altogether through your browser.
